intro: Gynochthodes macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf gynochthodes, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its large, ovate leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
